snippet: Ian Clement’s seven-ton postal truck rolled over Marilyn Dershovitz and her bicycle in 2011. The prosecutor says the defendant knew or should have known that someone was hurt.
abstract: Testimony begins in trial of Ian Clement, Manhattan postal truck driver charged with leaving the scene of fatal accident involving bicyclist Marilyn Dershowitz in Chelsea in 2011; Clement, who says that he was unaware he had run over Dershowitz as she navigated a busy street, faces up to seven years in prison if convicted.
lead_paragraph: Ian Clement’s seven-ton postal truck rolled over Marilyn Dershovitz and her bicycle in 2011. The prosecutor says the defendant knew or should have known that someone was hurt.

headline.seo: Driver’s Trial in Bike Crash That Killed Marilyn Dershowitz Opens
headline.main: Mail-Truck Driver Tried on Charges of Leaving Scene of Fatal Bike Accident
headline.print_headline: Bicyclist’s Widower Testifies at Trial of Driver Accused of Leaving Accident Scene
